Summary: This quick and easy Million Dollar Dip (Neiman Marcus Dip) is the ultimate party favorite! Made in minutes with bacon, cheddar, mayo, and almonds!
Instructions: In a medium bowl, add 1 ½ cups mayonnaise, 8 ounces shredded cheddar cheese, 5 chopped green onions, ½ cup real bacon bits, and ½ cup slivered almonds. Mix until combined.
Cover and chill for at least 2 hours.
Comments: Val says:This looks great, but I tend to like sour cream more than mayo in dips. Do you think this would work if I used half sour cream and half mayo?
Alyssa Rivers says:Sour cream will work in place of the mayo, it will just add a little bit more tang to the dip.
Patricia Andrade says:I will be trying this out this weekend
Beckie says:What a lovely person you are . Raising 4 children ,working tiresly to perfect recipes. Just found your recipe today and hope to find more. Many blessings to you and your family
Alyssa Rivers says:Thanks for making me feel seen Beckie! I really appreciate your comment! Many blessings to you and yours as well!
B J says:Can leftovers be frozen?
Alyssa Rivers says:No, I don’t suggest freezing this dip. The mayonnaise in it will separate and become watery if frozen and thawed.
Mary Garcia says:I made the marry me chicken pasta it was great. Loved it. Thank you. Looking for easy meatless dishes.
Amanda says:Made this and it was ok, nothing spectacular, I thought it was really salty! I believe the culprit was the bacon bits. If I make this again I will use real bacon instead.
Diana says:We make this every year in triple batches for our holiday gathering and always gone. Passed along to lots of peeps. Love it
Alyssa Rivers says:It’s so simple but so good! Thanks for sharing!
Karen says:I think you forgot the cream cheese!
Alyssa Rivers says:Hi Karen, this recipe doesn’t call for cream cheese. If you are looking for a similar flavor but with cream cheese you should try my baked bacon dip!
